a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Birth rate vs. death rate, 1950 to 2021
Rates are given per 1,000 people in the country's population. Countries above the gray line have a higher birth than
death rate, meaning that the total population is increasing; those below the line have a declining population.
Average annual change in deaths per 1,000
Average annual change in births per 1,000
Data source: United Nations, World Population Prospects (2022)
